p.value: Donated by Curt Royston in 2009 and 2014. The accession numbers associated with these gifts are 2009.259 and 2014.259.
This collection is arranged into four series by format.

Curt Royston is best known for his proficiency in a variety of media: painting, sculpture, photography, film, and video, and often in combination. His work has been shown extensively throughout the United States and Europe including a 1987 one-man exhibition at the Whitney Museum of American Art.

extent.value: in 2 manuscript boxes, 1 record carton, and 1 film can.

abstract.value: The Curt Royston Papers consists of reviews, promotional matierals, transparencies, film, and video recordings relating to Royston's career as a filmmaker. Materials date from 1982 to 2000.

physloc.value: Some materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

p.value: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

Published citations should take the following form:

Identification of item, date (if known); Curt Royston Papers; MSS 259; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
In 2018 materials from accretion 2014.259 were processed and intellectually incorporated into the collection. Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes.

head.value: Related Material at Fales Library and Special Collections

p.value: Lisa Fox and Curt Royston Papers (MSS 249).
This collection contains reviews, promotional matierals, transparencies, film, and video recordings relating to Curt Royston's career as a filmmaker. Materials date from 1982 to 2000.

Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Curt Royston was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
